intro: Senecio pomatensis, commonly known as the woolly senecio, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its unique, woolly foliage. The plant features narrow, gray-green leaves covered in a dense layer of fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It produces small yellow flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Senecio pomatensis is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its striking foliage and low maintenance requirements.
